name: df-polarityN
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(cpolN, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpt(s1, cpw(cfv(catm, cv(s0))), cin(cfv(catm, cv(s0)), ciin(s2, cv(s1), cfv(cfv(cpmap, cv(s0)), cfv(cfv(coc, cv(s0)), cv(s2))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ _|_P =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà P((Atoms ` s0))‚Ü¶((Atoms ` s0)‚ãÇ ‚ãÇ(s2 ‚àà s1,((pmap ` s0)`((oc ` s0)` s2))))))
comment: Define polarity of projective subspace, which is a kind of complement of the subspace. Item 2 in [Holland95] p. 222 bottom. For more generality, we define it for all subsets of atoms, not just projective subspaces. The intersection with ` Atoms `` l ` ensures it is defined when ` m = (/) ` . (Contributed by NM, 23-Oct-2011.)
